SEARCH
Package com.otabi.jcodroneedu

Class ButtonData

java.lang.Object
com.otabi.jcodroneedu.ButtonData
public class ButtonData extends Object
Immutable data class representing button state from the CoDrone EDU controller.

This class provides a type-safe, Java-idiomatic way to access button data, recommended over the array-based Drone.getButtonData() method.

Usage Example:


 // Recommended Java approach
 ButtonData buttonData = drone.getButtonDataObject();
 System.out.println("Button event: " + buttonData.getEventName());
 System.out.println("Button flags: " + buttonData.getButtonFlags());
 System.out.println("Timestamp: " + buttonData.getTimestamp());
 
 // Check for specific button press
 if (buttonData.getButtonFlags() == 1 && 
     (buttonData.getEventName().equals("Press") || buttonData.getEventName().equals("Down"))) {
     System.out.println("L1 button pressed!");
 }

Button Flags:

  • 0 = No button
  • 1 = L1
  • 2 = L2
  • 4 = R1
  • 8 = R2

Event Names:

  • "None_" = No event
  • "Press" = Button just pressed
  • "Down" = Button held down
  • "Up" = Button just released

Hardware Limitation:

Important: The CoDrone EDU controller uses a multiplexed button scanning matrix that cannot detect multiple buttons on the same side pressed simultaneously (e.g., L1 + L2, or R1 + R2). However, it can detect one button from each side pressed together (e.g., L1 + R1). This is a hardware limitation, not a software bug.

Since:
1.0.0

    • ButtonData

      public ButtonData(double timestamp, int buttonFlags, String eventName)
      Creates a new ButtonData instance.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - The timestamp in seconds when the button data was captured
      buttonFlags - The button flags indicating which button(s) are active
      eventName - The event name ("Press", "Down", "Up", or "None_")
